history.content:
Not sure if you can do it with your laptop but you can print from the lab computers. The printer is in a room opposite to one of the labs (adjacent to the elevators IIRC). 

When you print on lab computers, the printer options on those computers will show which room the printer is located.

====

You get 200 pages of free printing total, and you can print off of your personal laptop (or even your phone). Your steps are:

  1. SCP the file onto your account on hive*.cs.berkeley.edu
  2. SSH onto that same account
  3. "lpr *filename*"

Those hive machines automatically choose to print to Soda 330, so just walk there and pick it up.

(I think printing from command line gives you priority over printing from the physical hive machines - in other words, your document will skip the queue and print first. That happened to me, even though so many people were on hive machines trying to print.)

Not sure if you can do it with your laptop but you can print from the lab computers. The printer is in a room opposite to one of the labs (adjacent to the elevators IIRC). 

When you print on lab computers, the printer options on those computers will show which room the printer is located.
Not sure if you can do it with your laptop but you can print from the lab computers. The printer is in a room opposite to one of the labs (adjacent to the elevators IIRC).

children.subject:
I made a script to upload a file to the instructional computer and print from your laptop.

You can read the source, but this (1) assumes that you have passwordless (ssh) access to your account and (2) requires you to modify line 11 with the proper inst account name and (3) assumes that ~/Downloads/ exists on the remote machine.

I recommend moving it to `/usr/local/bin/print_soda`, and running `chmod u+x`, then you'll probably be able to just type `print_soda ~/path/to/file.pdf` and it'll upload and print that file to the printer in soda 330.

https://gist.github.com/glinia/095bd3852de88ef1fd1973ae05637c9f

history.content:
How does one go about printing something in Soda? I've never done it before, though I know that students enrolled in CS classes get free printing up to a certain limit. Where are the printers located? Can I print off my personal laptop, or do I need to bring a flash drive or use the lab computers? Any other tips or things to be aware of?

Thanks!
history.subject: Printing in Soda
